intro: Spiranthes luteoalba, commonly known as the yellow spiraea, is a species of orchid native to North America. It is characterized by its delicate, spiral-shaped flower clusters that are typically yellow or cream in color. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are pollinated by insects, particularly bees. It prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Spiranthes luteoalba is a perennial herb that blooms in late spring to early summer.
